snippet: Naval police in Rhode Island did not alert superiors to evidence pointing to Aaron Alexis’s mental instability.
abstract: Pentagon officials say naval police in Rhode Island did not alert superiors in Washington to evidence pointing to mental instability of Aaron Alexis, former Navy reservists who the police say killed 12 people at a Washington Navy Yard base.

byline.original: By TRIP GABRIEL and THOM SHANKER
byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt and Joseph Goldstein contributed reporting from Washington, and Marc Santora from New York.

lead_paragraph: Naval police in Rhode Island did not alert superiors to evidence pointing to Aaron Alexis’s mental instability.

headline.main: Officials Never Learned of Police Doubts on Gunman’s Stability
headline.print_headline: Officials Never Learned of Police Doubts on Gunman’s Stability
